>
> assertEqual( exitValue, ... );

This look nice for me :-)

Have you tried it yet?

I guesss you will need to call mainProcess.waitFor()
before mainProcess.exitValue() because of

Javadoc for exitValue():
"Throws: IllegalThreadStateException - if the subprocess represented
by this Process object has not yet terminated."

You should use this as a safety net for refactoring. You should refactor
main()
so that it is testable without process startup/shutdown, because this is
really to slow
for unit tests.

Bernd
